page.title: 04HISTORIC MONUMENTS
page.content: The Mount is the remains of an ancient fortified dwelling and is situated in the townland of Ballymaghery where all the ancient roads met.It is shaped like a large overturned bowl surrounded by what must have been a moat.It lies about a mile east of Hilltown village.It overlooks part of the valley of the River Bann.It was used as a fortress. It is situated on the farm of Pat Keenan.Legend has said that there is a cave opening at the mount.This cave is supposed to lead to the Goward Dolmen which is about two miles away over the Goward hill. The mount is a favourite haunt of school children during the summer.My class went with one of our past teacher's Mr.Hanna some time ago.
